message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.LG

The paper deals with verification problems of programs written in various paradigms, which involves solving Horn clause constraints on predicate variables that represent unknown inductive invariants. This makes it likely to belong to the Logic (cs.LO) and Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-categories. The paper also introduces a novel proof system tailored to Horn constraint solving, which makes it relevant to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. The paper specifically mentions the verification of programs written in functional languages such as OCaml, which makes it relevant to the Formal Languages and Automata Theory (cs.FL) sub-category. Finally, the paper also mentions the use of an SMT solver, which makes it relevant to the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LG) sub-category.
